content: The auto update is the default, but can be set to not do that. Older versions are available at https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/ - I suggest making a copy of the profile folder at the ...appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder, uninstalling the new version, installing your preferred version, and setting the auto update to no. You may need to remove a compatibility.ini file in the profile if you get message of incompatibility.
creator: davidsk

content: First, this forum is staffed volunteers, not developers. We cope with upgrades the same as everyone else. The auto update feature can be turned off, although I admit it's the default. My guess is that thunderbird may have created a new profile. Were you prompted to create an email address? The old profile should still be available. Try this: help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles' and see if there is a second, inactive, profile there. If so, see if you can launch it.
creator: davidsk

content: Please add more detail on your problem. Including a screenshot may help.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hello there We have read that message We try to help.


Being blacklisted is not a Thunderbird issue on the blacklist and Thunderbird is not. You can make contact with that email provider for what reason that blacklist is created.

Are you using mail provider svthen contact them for more information. Try to find out what that reason is that you are on that so called blacklist there? Try to use temporarily other email client s for some moments to see if that issue is really only there at Thunderbird (try to use webmail for a second and them come back to Thunderbird.) That other email program Outlook or Gmail that is been used there in combination with Thunderbird client and Is become being blocked with that ip adres , if you can contact your email provider to solve that issue and ask permission there to get of there blacklist to go on that so called white list and continue to use that provider and try to get on that approved so called white list and use Thunderbird again after that solved problem there. For having a good day again with us .


Greetings googlethunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there Being on the blacklist there it means you can receive emails normally.That blacklist only focus on the outgoing mail , that means there is no option to send mail because you went blocked for a period of time.

The most common things around for being blocked that way is that you are sending spam messages , maybe that you are sending these mails without knowing , misbehaviour is one of the common populair subjects to get blocked and to send mail again. Other emails has to be delivered are blocked by the email server even if there is some sort of incoming mail to that inbox all of the other mail is being blocked to by that presented email server for your mail that day.

What you might not see is that a lot of mail that is going around from your account that is called in the year 2025 spammy mail , that kind of mail is not really spam but a little bit spam. It might being recognised by other human when searching for these spam or anti spam bots that might have matched that issue again of the new spreading misbehaviours. Providers has owning there own list of blacklists so they can help you out if you make a clear call to them or by sending them that email to arrange a deal. To stay of that blacklist is by you. Seek for trusted feedbacks to solve this.

Greetings googlethunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Potrebbe essere un bug delle versioni recenti, dato che c'è stata almeno una segnalazione simile alla tua. Hai lo stesso comportamento in Modalità risoluzione dei problemi? -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/modalita-risoluzione-problemi-thunderbird

Per poter inquadrare il problema prova inoltre a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
Buongiorno,

il problema si presenta anche nella modalità risoluzione problemi.

La versione di Thunderbird è 140.0.1 (64 bit) Il sistema operativo e Windows 10 Pro, versione 22H2 Il provider delle caselle è Shellrent, caselle appoggiate su nostro dominio rk-elettronica.it Account POP3 Nessuna estensione installata Nessun messaggio d'errore (cliccando su nuovo messaggio o con Ctrl-N non succede nulla) Antivirus presente: soltano Windows Defender

L'aggiornamento è stato installato sabato 12 luglio 2025 alle 08.40 locali Il problema è stato rilevato ieri quando è stato necessario comporre un nuovo messaggio (le funzioni rispondi e inoltra funzionano regolarmente)

content:
Ok, grazie delle informazioni. Sto raccogliendo il materiale disponibile su questo problema qui -> https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=79683.0 dove eventualmente pubblicherò anche eventuali aggiornamenti.

Al momento l'unica soluzione che mi viene in mente è quella di tornare alla versione precedente di Thunderbird, preferibilmente:

(1) Fai un backup -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo (2) Scarica ed installa una versione precedente sopra quella attuale -> https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/ (3) Se ricevi messaggi di errore relativi al profilo, leggi qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-dedicati-installazione-thunderbird#w_cosa-succede-a-un-profilo-se-si-retrocede-thunderbird-a-una-versione-precedente e qui -> https://gioxx.org/2021/08/04/impossibile-utilizzare-il-profilo-avviando-una-versione-precedente-di-thunderbird/

content:
Prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail problematiche -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]
creator: @next

content:
La cause possono essere molte, le prime che mi vengono in mente: - con il protocollo IMAP le mail sono state cancellate dal server o da qualche altra applicazione - il database delle mail è danneggiato - l'indice delle mail è danneggiato

Per gli ultimi due problemi prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella problematica -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

Infine esiste in Thunderbird un terzo strumento di ricerca, meno intuitivo ma più potente che puoi provare Tasto menu > Strumenti > Ricerca messaggi
creator: @next

content: Ein paar Informationen könntest du schon liefern. Welcher ist der "v.g. Ordner", den du aus Versehen gelöscht hast? Hast du etwa den Ordner "Local Folders" aus dem Thunderbird Profil gelöscht? Ist es ein Ordner, der sich in den Lokalen Ordnern befand? Falls ja, solltest du zunächst im Papierkorb der Lokalen Ordner suchen.

content: When you delete a local folder, it goes to the Trash folder. If you have emptied the Trash folder, it is probably lost.

content: Please check at 'account setting' to confirm that you have defined a default account. There will be a star to the right of the account name. If there is not one, click the 'set as default' button on the desired account pane. This is, to my knowledge, a reported bug.
creator: davidsk

content:
Corollary:

The Date header for my email:

Date: Wed, 16 Jul 2025 14:24:06 +0000

By default it displays correctly as having been received on July 17 2025 00:24 +1000. And that's what the Received header says.

When I set the TZ=Australia/AEST environment variable, I get this:

Received: Thu, 17 Jul 2025 00:24:14 +1000 Date: Wed, 16 Jul 2025 14:24:06 +0000

But now the Date header is displayed. So the headers themselves are consistent. But they are being swapped (i.e. the datetime that displays in the UI) depending on whether I set the environment variable or not.
creator: firefox2506

content: You seem to have installed thunderbird from microsoft. the preferred source is https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/ the MS version installs to appdata\local in a Microsoft subfolder (I do not know specifics). One of the problems is that help>troublesshootinginformation doesn't work properly with the MS version,
